item.title: MoparClassic IRC
item.dc:creator: @fran_ta_the_brah fran ta the brah
item.description:
@fran_ta_the_brah wrote:

[quote=“The Enforcer, post:24, topic:529923”]This can’t attributed to the current RSCE staff, I am just not up-to-date with the situations in this community. I can tell what was going on there back in the days when Luke ran it.

I can’t remember what my disagreement with him was, but he banned me. Probably for autocasting and autocatching. I found such injustice unacceptable, considering my higher privileges in society. I then proceeded to crash his server and dupe on it for a few days. He then offered me a deal that he will supply me with unlimited accounts and items in game, so I wouldn’t have to dupe. It seemed like a good offer, after all I could only make myself more items, but not accounts. After that he offered me money to crash other servers and dupe on them. I crashed the servers, and he went bragging about it like it was his achievement. I used to provide him sets of 100s of party hats on other servers and he went around having drop parties like some little kid.

Just a story from the past.[/quote]
change my mind for ever plz link a video

Read full topic

item.title: MoparClassic IRC
item.dc:creator: @The_Enforcer The Enforcer
item.description:
@The_Enforcer wrote:

This can’t attributed to the current RSCE staff, I am just not up-to-date with the situations in this community. I can tell what was going on there back in the days when Luke ran it.

I can’t remember what my disagreement with him was, but he banned me. Probably for autocasting and autocatching. I found such injustice unacceptable, considering my higher privileges in society. I then proceeded to crash his server and dupe on it for a few days. He then offered me a deal that he will supply me with unlimited accounts and items in game, so I wouldn’t have to dupe. It seemed like a good offer, after all I could only make myself more items, but not accounts. After that he offered me money to crash other servers and dupe on them. I crashed the servers, and he went bragging about it like it was his achievement. I used to provide him sets of 100s of party hats on other servers and he went around having drop parties like some little kid.

Just a story from the past.

Read full topic

item.title: MoparClassic IRC
item.dc:creator: @Not_a_bot Not_a_bot
item.description:
@Not_a_bot wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:14, topic:529923”]Give it a rest Not_a_bot.

There was never any particularly convincing evidence that Luke was guilty of anything more than drawing the ire of rival server owners because he operated his own successful server and basically held a monopoly on the playerbase.
I don’t have the messages anymore (my inbox obviously became considerably smaller after resigning as an administrator) but as I recall they would be considered circumstantial at best. And even then they could have been clever photoshop jobs and so on.[/quote]

I’m sorry, I’m doing what you and many of the staff have failed to do, which is to prove that RSCEmulation is run by corrupt individuals intentionally taking advantage of a primarily uneducated community. You can also stop twisting my words and accusing me of attacking Luke as it’s not even relevant. I’m trying to make people aware of what goes on behind the scenes of these “popular” private servers, so they don’t become victimized by digital handcuffs. I have spoken with another moderator about this situation and am actively investigating it myself (on my free time). I do have other evidence I don’t wish to share at this point since it would only be covered up by a few moderators on here who are friends with the current staff.

Whether you want to believe it or not, you cannot deny there has been a logical consistency between “servers getting attacked” and RSCEmulation’s drawn out survival. They (the collective whole as a staff) do have the time and resources to create drama, no other individual at this point in time (even malicious people like T_X or “Tewl”) have anything to gain from these types of attacks. On top of that, it’s not exactly hard to buy and obtain tools for denial of service attacks these days, literally anyone with $10 can shutdown a service of their liking.

Try thinking it through and seeing the obvious connections, who really has something to gain from it when other legitimate competition is brought down? You earn money from it, you see it as a business. If you can gain the upper hand on another competitor by exploiting their weaknesses you have spent lots of time fixing up yourself, you are bound to do the same (regardless of intent).

[youtube]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SUJtMlEwd6Q[/youtube]

Read full topic

item.title: MoparClassic IRC
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

I’m not accusing anyone in particular (might be rsce but it just as equally might not be). I’m just saying that I believe that whoever is attacking the ircd is doing it because of mopar classic.

Also, I’m in agreement that people shouldn’t really talk to much shit about Kryptix. He did his best to make up for his shady past. The reason he was unliked is because people were jealous he could profit from a game they all played.

Read full topic

I’m merely making my findings at the time public so that people can find another scapegoat.[/quote]I was actually talking to Not_a_bot as well (or anyone else that still wants to talk shit about him)

item.title: MoparClassic IRC
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:14, topic:529923”]There was never any particularly convincing evidence that Luke was guilty of anything more than drawing the ire of rival server owners because he operated his own successful server and basically held a monopoly on the playerbase.
I don’t have the messages anymore (my inbox obviously became considerably smaller after resigning as an administrator) but as I recall they would be considered circumstantial at best. And even then they could have been clever photoshop jobs and so on.[/quote]I personally handled many cases of people trying to report him for things, and on multiple occasions he provided much more concrete evidence (with teamviewer for example) that things posted about him were either completely falsified (there was an email for example that someone just completely edited and tried to use to get his server removed) or circumstantial.

He never denied that he had a shady past, he openly admitted it and openly discussed anything he was accused of. I think we should leave his memory in peace and not try to smudge his name now when he can’t even do anything to defend himself.

Read full topic

item.title: MoparClassic IRC
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Give it a rest Not_a_bot.

There was never any particularly convincing evidence that Luke was guilty of anything more than drawing the ire of rival server owners because he operated his own successful server and basically held a monopoly on the playerbase.
I don’t have the messages anymore (my inbox obviously became considerably smaller after resigning as an administrator) but as I recall they would be considered circumstantial at best. And even then they could have been clever photoshop jobs and so on.

Read full topic

item.description:
@cleako wrote:

Back in the days of Luke, he would swear up and down that he never would send a ddos against a rival server. He seemed earnest enough but from that sort of income, irregardless of the amount of work he put into developing it and overall well functioning management team, I never quite knew what to believe.

item.title: MoparClassic IRC
item.dc:creator: @Not_a_bot Not_a_bot
item.description:
@Not_a_bot wrote:

[quote=“cleako, post:7, topic:529923”][quote author=Newty link=topic=648678.msg4362307#msg4362307 date=1379001601]
Good job, this channel has already brought its first ddos to our network.
[/quote]

This is disappointing. I do not see what would motivate someone other than profit to do such a thing against this project.[/quote]

See RSCEmulation… The spyware released on their (RSCE) client + loss of profit from the release of MoparClassic is a perfect motive for denial of service attacks. This is not a coincidence people, notice how every server that has a legitimate threat towards RSCEmulation seems to be attacked in some way…? Legitimate proof is coming soon, for the meantime I will provide you with an informative video.

[youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=R3xXFSMd20A[/youtube]

Read full topic
